item.Name: Use multi-modal reflection sorting#Reduces pathfinding generation overhead (risky)
big vehicle use center point for light sampling!
in space#so we can hide hud elements like the compass
survival#so we can strip the elite from the global player representations
do not strip variants#so we can test the impact of variant stripping

_field_string_id.name: map name#Used to associate external resources with this map - e.g. PDA camera setting block names.

_field_real.name: local sea level:wu#used to calculate aircraft altitude

_field_real_point_3d.name: sandbox origin point#forge coordinates are relative to this point

_field_struct.name: static data
_field_struct._field_explanation: Settings for the position of the nodegraph
Settings for the projection and camera used to see the nodegraph
Settings for interacting with the nodegraph

_field_real.name: structure vertex sink#this is the most that we can sink a soft surface link snow in the structure_bsp via vertex painting.

item.Name: vista bsp#Also known as proxy bsp and cinematic bsp. Non playable bsp, only used for rendering vistas or cinematics. This bsp will not contribute to default object/effect/sound lifetime, navmesh, acoustics, or calculations determining the networking bounds of the world.
dont use extra lighting bsps for cubemaps

_field_real.name: custom gravity scale#0==nogravity, 1==full, set the custom gravity scale flag to make this parameter active

_field_long_integer.name: forge lightmap size*!#Do not modify me, I get written with correct value in the tag post-process

_field_char_enum.name: initial team#Only used on certain base types.

_field_block_64.name: game portal to door occluder mapping

_field_real_point_3d.name: world bounds min#Physics world will include this min point
world bounds max#Physics world will include this max point

_field_tag_reference_64.name: cinematic soundbank#only for cinematics. If you try to use this for anything else without talking to me, i will stab you in the face

_field_real_rgb_color.name: sky clear color#linear color, must check override flag above to use

item.Name: scripted#the level script will set this value; the other settings here will be ignored.
invert#result of function is one minus actual result
always active#function does not deactivate when at or below lower bound

_field_real.name: period:seconds#this is the period for the above function (lower values make the function oscillate quickly, higher values make it oscillate slowly)

_field_short_block_index.name: scale period by#multiply this function by the above period
scale function by#multiply this function by the result of the above function

_field_short_enum.name: wobble function#the curve used for the wobble

_field_real.name: wobble period:seconds#the length of time it takes for the magnitude of this function to complete a wobble
wobble magnitude:percent#the amount of random wobble in the magnitude

_field_real_fraction.name: square wave threshold#if non-zero, all values above the square wave threshold are snapped to 1.0, and all values below it are snapped to 0.0 to create a square wave.

_field_short_integer.name: step count#the number of discrete values to snap to (e.g., a step count of 5 would snap the function to 0.00,0.25,0.50,0.75 or 1.00)
sawtooth count#the number of times this function should repeat (e.g., a sawtooth count of 5 would give the function a value of 1.0 at each of 0.25,0.50,0.75 as well as at 1.0

_field_short_block_index.name: scale result by#multiply this function (from a weapon, vehicle, etc.) final result of all of the above math

_field_short_enum.name: bounds mode#controls how the bounds, below, are used

_field_short_block_index.name: turn off with#if the specified function is off, so is this function

item.Name: navmesh collision node opt in#mesh will only be generated on collision nodes marked as generate

_field_short_block_index.name: parent object*!#if an object with this name exists, we attach to it as a child

_field_string_id.name: parent name#if an object with this name exists, we attach to it as a child

_field_real.name: Directional Acceleration Mult. #Multiplier applied to all phantoms' direction acceleration factors. Used to scale man-cannon strength.
Man Cannon Apex Height#this number isn't in any kind of discernable units. small numbers make shallow arcs, large make bigger arcs.

_field_block_64.name: Spartan Tracking#override default spartan tracking behavior for this object

_field_explanation.name: Map these settings to a ping type

_field_block_64._field_explanation:
Active - This is generated manually by the player, by pressing a button on their controller. This behavior will override passive behavior.
Passive - This is a constant ping, automatically generated by the tracking system. Use this to mark things automatically as the player comes into range.
You should create at most one block of Spartan Tracking data for each ping type. If you have more, only the first will be used.

_field_char_enum.name: ping type^#ping type to which these settings apply

item.Name: trackable#this object may respond to the ping of a Spartan tracking device
enabled by default#this object is trackable by default, i.e. tracking does not need to be enabled via script
outline#render an outline around the object when pinged
immediate response#ping affects this object immediately, only applicable to active ping type
follow offscreen#nav marker will follow this object while offscreen
do not track children#prevent tracking of child objects
do not outline children#prevent outlining of child objects

_field_char_enum.name: priority#category used to limit the number of simultaneously marked targets
outline color index#index into outline material's 4-color 'outline_color' parameter

_field_real_fraction.name: outline intensity:(0,1] - if 0, default from tracking globals tag will be used
outline thickness:(0,1] - if 0, default from tracking globals tag will be used

_field_string_id.name: nav point screen#name of the screen used to mark this object when hit by a ping
nav point label#label displayed via the nav point screen

_field_real.name: nav point vertical offset:world units#offset used when displaying the nav point screen and label

_field_block_64._field_explanation: Leave the override set to 0 if you'd like to use the default range. A set of default ranges, for each ping type, is stored under the Spartan Tracking section of globals.globals. Each set specifies a default range for each target priority.

_field_real.name: range&range override#maximum distance at which this object can be hit by a ping

_field_long_flags.name: team filter#character teams that can't ping this object

item.Name: blue team#The Chief and his crew
blue team cracked#The Chief and his crew, but Chief has a cracked visor

_field_tag_reference_64.name: ping hit instigator effect 0&team Chief ping hit instigator effect#effect on the spartan when this object is hit by ping
ping hit instigator effect 1{ping hit instigator effect}&team Locke ping hit instigator effect#effect on the spartan when this object is hit by ping
ping hit instigator effect 2&team Chief (cracked visor) ping hit instigator effect#effect on the spartan when this object is hit by ping
ping hit effect 0&team Chief ping hit effect#effect on this object when hit by ping
ping hit effect 1{ping hit effect}&team Locke ping hit effect#effect on this object when hit by ping
ping hit effect 2&team Chief (cracked visor) ping hit effect#effect on this object when hit by ping

_field_string_id.name: target object name#if an object with this name exists, it will be an associate

_field_struct.name: multiplayer data
_field_struct._field_explanation: object data for multiplayer game use

_field_short_block_index.name: parent object*!#if an object with this name exists, we attach to it as a child

_field_string_id.name: parent name#if an object with this name exists, we attach to it as a child

_field_real.name: Running Start Total Length In Seconds
Running Start Third Person Cam Length In Seconds

Apply Spawn Zone Properties To Inital Spawn
navmesh collision node opt in#mesh will only be generated on collision nodes marked as generate

_field_block_64.name: Spartan Tracking#override default spartan tracking behavior for this object

_field_explanation.name: Map these settings to a ping type

_field_block_64._field_explanation:
Active - This is generated manually by the player, by pressing a button on their controller. This behavior will override passive behavior.
Passive - This is a constant ping, automatically generated by the tracking system. Use this to mark things automatically as the player comes into range.
You should create at most one block of Spartan Tracking data for each ping type. If you have more, only the first will be used.

_field_char_enum.name: ping type^#ping type to which these settings apply

enabled by default#this object is trackable by default, i.e. tracking does not need to be enabled via script

immediate response#ping affects this object immediately, only applicable to active ping type
follow offscreen#nav marker will follow this object while offscreen
do not track children#prevent tracking of child objects
do not outline children#prevent outlining of child objects

_field_struct.name: override distance parameters
_field_struct._field_explanation: these settings vary how the sound fades as you move closer or further away from it.

_field_real.name: don't obstruct distance:world units#don't obstruct below this distance
don't play distance:world units#don't play below this distance
attack distance:world units#start playing at full volume at this distance
minimum distance:world units#start attenuating at this distance
sustain begin distance:world units#set attenuation to sustain db at this distance
sustain end distance:world units#continue attenuating to silence at this distance
maximum distance:world units#the distance beyond which this sound is no longer audible
sustain db:dB#the amount of attenuation between sustain begin and end

_field_string_id.name: target object name#if an object with this name exists, it will be an associate

_field_real_fraction.name: starting health damage:[0,1]
starting shield damage:[0,1]

_field_char_enum.name: avatar name#only a player that has this avatar will receive this loadout

_field_block_64.name: goals
_field_block_64._field_explanation: Use the event connection to have the Goal react to Events and/or send out Events.

_field_short_block_index.name: Start Condition Event#[IN]Event that will activate this goal
Start Event#[OUT]Event that will be signaled out when this goal gets activated
Completed Condition Event#[IN]Event that will trigger a completion of this goal.
Completed Event#[OUT]Event that will be signaled out when this goal is completed.
Cancel Condition Event#[IN]Event that will trigger a cancellation of this goal
Cancel Event#[OUT]Event that will be signaled out when this goal is canceled.

_field_block_64._field_explanation: Use Goal connections to listen to and signal other Goals.
Settings used when the goal is active.

_field_block_64.name: squad script controller
_field_block_64._field_explanation: Use the event connection to have the Squad react to Events and/or send out Events.
Use Goal owner to connect the squad to a goal.
Call for reinforcements or signal for completion.

_field_block_64.name: crate script controller
_field_block_64._field_explanation: Use the event connection to have the Create react to Events and/or send out Events.
Use Goal owner to connect the crate to a goal.

_field_string_id.name: debug squad override (only used for debugging compositions)

_field_block_64.name: trigger volumes
_field_block_64._field_explanation: the name of the trigger volume specifies what kind of volume it is: 'zone_set:' 'begin_zone_set:' 'kill' (plus '_soft' for soft kill volume) 'playerkill' (plus '_soft' for soft kill volume) for player only kill volume 'safe_zone' (plus '_soft' for soft kill volume) 'location_' 'unsafe_spawn' append ':*' to zone set names to allow vehicles to teleport along with their players.

_field_real.name: z sink#this is only valid for sector type trigger volumes

_field_string_id.name: dialogue pattern location#location for variants of ai dialogue. See narrative for the acceptable list

plugin._field_explanation: You can use the following to override multiplayer global spawn influencers for the scenario. Default settings are defined in multiplayer/multiplayer_globals.multiplayer_globals.

item.Name: force planar#force decal to be 2 triangle quad. does not clip to geometry

_field_pad.name: soon to be an initial task

_field_real.name: initial movement distance#before doing anything else, the actor will travel the given distance in its forward direction
delay:seconds#how long the AI should pause at this point
angle:degrees#the angle-from-forward that the AI can pick at this point

_field_short_integer.name: swarm count#number of creatures in swarm if a swarm is spawned at this location

_field_real.name: initial movement distance#before doing anything else, the actor will travel the given distance in its forward direction
delay:seconds#how long the AI should pause at this point
angle:degrees#the angle-from-forward that the AI can pick at this point

_field_long_enum.name: wave placement filter#Filter which squads in Firefight waves can be spawned into this squad

_field_block_64.name: cells
_field_block_64._field_explanation: Specify the distribution of characters and weapons in the cell sub-folders

_field_short_integer.name: normal diff count#initial number of actors on normal difficulty

_field_real.name: delay:seconds#how long the AI should pause at this point
angle:degrees#the angle-from-forward that the AI can pick at this point

_field_block_64.name: cells
_field_block_64._field_explanation: Specify the distribution of characters and weapons in the cell sub-folders

_field_short_integer.name: normal diff count#initial number of actors on normal difficulty

_field_real.name: delay:seconds#how long the AI should pause at this point
angle:degrees#the angle-from-forward that the AI can pick at this point
hold time{occupy time}:seconds#How long the AI should pause at this point before searching
search time:seconds#How long the AI should search at this point before returning
pause time:seconds#How long the AI should pause at this point after searching before moving on
cooldown time:seconds#How long after being abandoned should this point be available again

_field_block_64.name: navmesh areas
_field_block_64._field_explanation: This controls the amount of simplification applied to internal segments and convex boundary segments
When simplifying internal segments and convex boundary segments, this controls the maximum projected distance by which the simplified segment can deviate from the unsimplified segment
This controls the amount of simplification applied to concave boundary segments
Maximum slope AI will traverse (degrees). Don't touch unless necessary.
Faces will only be merged if the cosine of the angle between their normals is greater than this.
Holes with area less than this are candidates for conversion to quads
The maximum number of faces that can be included in a partition. Basically, don't change this.
The area of any partition loop will not be reduced by more than this fraction
This the size of the cell used when using a Custom Air Volume

_field_block_64.name: Areas
_field_block_64._field_explanation: AKA Musketeer points.

_field_real.name: zThreshold:wus#Don't include firing points outside of this vertical margin

item.Name: don't kill immediately, and don't apply to air vehicles
don't kill immediately, and don't apply to air vehicles

_field_char_integer.name: mopp build type!*#they say it only matters for ps3

_field_tag_reference_64.name: weather sound#plays when rain is active, weather rate gets applied to scale.
entry sound#plays when entering this area
exit sound#plays when leaving this area

item.Name: use adjacent cluster as portal scale
use adjacent cluster as exterior scale

_field_real_fraction.name: interior scale DEPRICATED!
portal scale DEPRICATED!
exterior scale DEPRICATED!

item.Name: navmesh collision node opt in#mesh will only be generated on collision nodes marked as generate

_field_short_block_index.name: parent object*!#if an object with this name exists, we attach to it as a child

_field_string_id.name: parent name#if an object with this name exists, we attach to it as a child

_field_real.name: Directional Acceleration Mult. #Multiplier applied to all phantoms' direction acceleration factors. Used to scale man-cannon strength.
Man Cannon Apex Height#this number isn't in any kind of discernable units. small numbers make shallow arcs, large make bigger arcs.

_field_block_64.name: Spartan Tracking#override default spartan tracking behavior for this object

_field_explanation.name: Map these settings to a ping type

_field_block_64._field_explanation:
Active - This is generated manually by the player, by pressing a button on their controller. This behavior will override passive behavior.
Passive - This is a constant ping, automatically generated by the tracking system. Use this to mark things automatically as the player comes into range.
You should create at most one block of Spartan Tracking data for each ping type. If you have more, only the first will be used.

_field_char_enum.name: ping type^#ping type to which these settings apply

item.Name: trackable#this object may respond to the ping of a Spartan tracking device
enabled by default#this object is trackable by default, i.e. tracking does not need to be enabled via script
outline#render an outline around the object when pinged
immediate response#ping affects this object immediately, only applicable to active ping type
follow offscreen#nav marker will follow this object while offscreen
do not track children#prevent tracking of child objects
do not outline children#prevent outlining of child objects

_field_char_enum.name: priority#category used to limit the number of simultaneously marked targets
outline color index#index into outline material's 4-color 'outline_color' parameter

_field_real_fraction.name: outline intensity:(0,1] - if 0, default from tracking globals tag will be used
outline thickness:(0,1] - if 0, default from tracking globals tag will be used

_field_string_id.name: nav point screen#name of the screen used to mark this object when hit by a ping
nav point label#label displayed via the nav point screen

_field_real.name: nav point vertical offset:world units#offset used when displaying the nav point screen and label

_field_block_64._field_explanation: Leave the override set to 0 if you'd like to use the default range. A set of default ranges, for each ping type, is stored under the Spartan Tracking section of globals.globals. Each set specifies a default range for each target priority.

_field_real.name: range&range override#maximum distance at which this object can be hit by a ping

_field_long_flags.name: team filter#character teams that can't ping this object

item.Name: blue team#The Chief and his crew
blue team cracked#The Chief and his crew, but Chief has a cracked visor

_field_tag_reference_64.name: ping hit instigator effect 0&team Chief ping hit instigator effect#effect on the spartan when this object is hit by ping
ping hit instigator effect 1{ping hit instigator effect}&team Locke ping hit instigator effect#effect on the spartan when this object is hit by ping
ping hit instigator effect 2&team Chief (cracked visor) ping hit instigator effect#effect on the spartan when this object is hit by ping
ping hit effect 0&team Chief ping hit effect#effect on this object when hit by ping
ping hit effect 1{ping hit effect}&team Locke ping hit effect#effect on this object when hit by ping
ping hit effect 2&team Chief (cracked visor) ping hit effect#effect on this object when hit by ping

_field_string_id.name: target object name#if an object with this name exists, it will be an associate

_field_struct.name: multiplayer data
_field_struct._field_explanation: object data for multiplayer game use

Running Start Third Person Cam Length In Seconds

item.Name: Apply Spawn Zone Properties To Opposing Teams
Apply Spawn Zone Properties To Inital Spawn
Choose random destination if next destination is unset
If boids are grazing, will flee if scared

_field_real.name: ecology margin:wus#distance from ecology boundary that creature begins to be repulsed
weight#probability of producing at this source

_field_short_block_index.name: source volume#Specify a trigger volume for boids to spawn in said volume instead of a sphere
initial destination#boids from this source will proceed to this destination if set

_field_real.name: max destination volume penetration:wu#The farthest the boid will go inside our destination volume

_field_short_block_index.name: next destination#upon reaching this destination, the boid will proceed to its next destination if set

_field_real_bounds.name: production frequency bounds:boids/sec#How frequently boids are produced at one of the sources (limited by the max boid count)

_field_real.name: source scale to 0 radius:wus#Distance from a source at which the creature scales to full size
sink scale to 0 radius:wus#Distance from a sink at which the creature begins to scale to zero
flock destroy duration:sec#The number of seconds it takes to kill all units in the flock if it gets destroyed

_field_real_bounds.name: time spent grazing (lower to upper bound)
time between grazing (lower to upper bound)

_field_tag_reference_64.name: single shot sound for idle (randomly plays) override

_field_real_bounds.name: time between one off idle sounds per boid (lower to upper bound) override

_field_tag_reference_64.name: single shot sound for moving (randomly plays) override

_field_real_bounds.name: time between one off moving sounds per boid (lower to upper bound) override

_field_tag_reference_64.name: single shot sound for reacting to danger override
single shot sound for death override
single shot sound for shooting override

atmosphere globals#settings that apply to the entire scenario

_field_block_64.name: tasks*!

_field_real.name: zThreshold:wus#Don't include firing points outside of this vertical margin
maximum duration:seconds#Exhaust this task after it has been active for this long
exhaustion delay:seconds#When a task exhausts, hold actors in the task for this long before releasing them

_field_string_id.name: Exhaustion Script#static script that is run when the task is exhausted

_field_short_enum.name: dialogue type#when someone enters this task for the first time, they play this type of dialogue

_field_short_integer.name: Kungfu count#The number of guys under this task that should be allowed to fight the player at a time

_field_block_64._field_explanation: You don't need to modify these here. They are managed by the objectives ui

_field_short_integer.name: lifetime count#task will never want to suck in more then n guys over lifetime (soft ceiling only applied when limit exceeded
max body count#task becomes inactive after the given number of casualties

_field_real.name: min strength:[0,1]#task becomes inactive after the strength of the participants falls below the given level

_field_struct.name: brush

_field_real.name: move distance#drop height for drop to ground
angle snap interval#rotate brushes will snap to intervals of this
Editor cull distance#decorators will not draw beyond this distance from the camera

_field_struct._field_explanation: [] brush size -= brush feathering 0-9 brush opacity SHIFT+0-9 select palette SHIFT while painting will reverse the operation

_field_block_64.name: Coop teams#The visual representation for the coop fireteams in campaign
Coop player representation#The visual representation a character in the fireteam

_field_string_id.name: character first person hands variant name
character first person body (legs) variant name
character third person unit variant name

_field_block_64.name: hidden regions override#Applied to the first person body (legs) model. If this is left empty, will use the global hidden fpBody regions defined in playerglobals instead.

_field_real.name: time#if you finish in under this time you get the following bonus

plugin._field_explanation: specify zero for values that should use the data in the globals tag.

_field_block_64.name: garbage collection
_field_block_64._field_explanation: time before the game considers that following entities as garbage

_field_long_integer.name: Max dead body count #above this number, overloaded mp time is used to garbage collect dead bodies

_field_tag_reference_64.name: hud screen reference#appears for the player through the scenario
